meanings.definition: To surpass in sinning or wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outsinning her friends by doing more wrong things.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outsinning his brother by stealing more cookies.
meanings.sent3: The competition for outsinning in mischief was fierce among the siblings.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outsinning others in mischief was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The young troublemaker was known for outsinning everyone in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To commit a greater sin than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He felt guilty for trying to outsinning his friend by lying about the broken vase.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to be known for outsinning her classmates in dishonesty.
meanings.sent3: The race to outsinning in deceit led to unexpected consequences.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to outsinning in wrongdoing backfired on him.
meanings.sent5: The student's desire to outsinning in misdeeds only brought trouble.

meanings.sent1: The notorious criminal was known for outsinning in his unlawful activities.
meanings.sent2: She seemed to have a talent for outsinning in immoral acts.
meanings.sent3: The competition to outsinning in wrongdoing was intense among the group.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outsinning in transgressions was both impressive and concerning.
meanings.sent5: The villain's goal was to outsinning in wickedness and gain power.
